game.engine.image.sprite

Class DefaultSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.image.sprite.DefaultSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Image, Sprite
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WeakSprite

    public class DefaultSprite
extends Object
implements Sprite, Image
    Class for handling sprite images.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultSprite

        public DefaultSprite(BufferedImage image,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        Create a new sprite. The given BufferedImage will be used as is. So consider passing a copy of your original image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image that contains the sub-images
        width - Width of one sub-image
        height - Height of one sub-image

      • DefaultSprite

        protected DefaultSprite()
        When using this constructor you'll have to override all methods.

    • Method Detail

      • drawTile

        public void drawTile(Graphics2D g,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Draws a tile of this sprite. The tile is drawn with Bounds(0, 0, width, height). Consider creating a clipped Graphics2D object.
        Specified by:
        drawTile in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics2D object to draw on
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        width - The width of the Graphics object to draw on
        height - The height of the Graphics object to draw on

      • draw

        public void draw(Graphics2D g,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Draws the image on a given Graphics2D object
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Image
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw the image on
        width - The width to use for drawing
        height - The height to use for drawing

      • getTile

        public BufferedImage getTile(int x,
                             int y)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Get a tile of this sprite. Be careful with this method. Creates a copy of the underlying tile.
        Use Sprite.drawTile(Graphics2D, int, int, int, int) for faster action and less memory usage.
        Specified by:
        getTile in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage containing the tile

      • getSubSprite

        public Sprite getSubSprite(int x,
                           int y,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Get sub-sprite with given dimension. The returned DerivedSprite is linked with this sprite.
        Specified by:
        getSubSprite in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of first tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of first tile
        width - Width of the sub-sprite
        height - Height of the sub-sprite
        Returns:
        The sub-sprite in form of a DerivedSprite
